sub_topic: Probability of drawing a certain card from a deck of cards
message_1: What is the probability of drawing a king from a deck of cards that contains 4 kings and 52 cards in total?
message_2:
The probability of drawing a king from a deck of 52 cards with 4 kings is calculated by dividing the number of successful outcomes (drawing a king) by the total number of possible outcomes (drawing any card from the deck).

Probability = (Number of successful outcomes) / (Total number of possible outcomes)

In this case, there are 4 successful outcomes (drawing any of the 4 kings) and 52 possible outcomes (drawing any of the 52 cards).

Probability = 4/52

Simplifying the fraction, we get:

Probability = 1/13

So, the probability of drawing a king from a deck of 52 cards is 1/13 or approximately 0.0769 or 7.69%.
